message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.AI

This paper deals with the problem of estimating surface reflectance from RGB images, which is a common task in computer vision and graphics. The proposed method is learning-based and uses neural networks to estimate reflectance from unstructured input data. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves 3D scene capture and human-computer interaction, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.GR (Graphics). The use of neural networks and the creation of a large synthetic dataset indicate that it could be relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also mentions the use of RGBD sensors, which suggests that it could be related to cs.RO (Robotics). Finally, the paper proposes a real-time approach for reflectance estimation, which could be relevant to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it involves the development of efficient algorithms for real-time applications.
